column4: When I browse folders, there is no address bar where I can type where I want to go and copy the address of the folder
How do I put one there, I see no option for it
I still don't see an option to do that
Is there something I can install that puts an address bar?
Yeah, of the folder I'm in
so if I were in /lib it'll show /lib and I can type /lib/mount and it'll move to that folder
and then if I were to open a random folder I can copy and paste it somewhere else (IE: the search field and search for stuff in it)
you want this in GNOME's file manager, correct? :p
do you have ubuntu or kubuntu?
it's in the gnome main menu somewhere, should be called Configuration Editor
after opening the configuration editor, go to applications >> nautilus, and it's somewhere in there
i would check, but i'm not using GNOME :p
did you find it, cause i can give the instructions in more detail now? :p
always use location entry or something like that
